Gadsden Arts Artists Guild
Gadsden Arts Artists Guild
On display through September 6, 2025, 5PM EST
Bates Community Room
Enjoy the third Artists Guild exhibition of 2025, on view in the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum’s Bates Community Room through September 6, 2025. On display is artwork by
Nancy Adams, Wendy Adams, Inger Avant, Kelly Clark, Terrie Corbett, Brenda Francis, Mark Georgiades, Laura Harrod, Terry Hawkins, Honey Hilliard, William McKeown, Pam McLean, Barbara Psimas, Robert DeWitt Smith, Chuck Stannard, Jenny Swearingen, Joel Thornton, Doell West,
and
Harris Wiltsher
.
Image: Honey Hilliard, Secrets of the Brush, 2025, oil
Mission
The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum Artists Guild is a service group of Gadsden Arts, Inc. that exists to serve the art community and artists of the region, Gadsden Arts Center & Museum membership, and Gadsden County Schools through exhibitions and educational presentations.
About
This membership level is open to all emerging to established artists in the region. Artists Guild membership dues are $195 per year.
Join Today
Artists Guild Membership Benefits
Work (1-2 pieces) shown in 2 Artists Guild exhibitions throughout the year
Gadsden Arts receives a 30% commission on works sold (instead of 40%) in Artists Guild installations (does not apply to Museum Shop items or Out of Pocket exhibitions)
A Family Membership to the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum (Artists with memberships that have been renewed within the last 6 months pay the difference)
Publicity opportunities through Gadsden Arts monthly E-news and website
Requirements for Exhibiting
Membership dues and contact information must be current (this is the artist member’s responsibility).
Artists must furnish works for exhibition upon request or may lose their spot in the artist exhibition rotation.
All work must be provided ready to install/hang, properly mounted or framed, with wire for hanging (no clips or saw-toothed hangers).
All artwork brought for the exhibition is accompanied by a Loan Agreement and W-9 form.
Each artist is responsible to bring/ship artwork to and from Gadsden Arts.

Memberships
Join Gadsden Arts or renew your membership today!
You are invited to become a part of our organization
You can help inspire exploration of the visual arts to enrich life for everyone by joining the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum. You will help bring major art exhibitions to our community, promote work by our region’s artists, and provide fun and educational art programs for thousands of children. You will become part of an organization that brings people together and contributes to the cultural and economic vitality of our community.
You will also receive great members’ benefits including free admission year-round, discounts, and invitations to cultural events. With a reciprocal membership, you are a member of the North American Reciprocal Museums (NARM) network, with benefits at world-class museums across the country.
Join or Renew Today!
Membership Benefits
Individual, Senior, and Student Memberships
Admission for two adults
10% Museum Shop discount
Invitation to GACM Events
E-news subscription
Rentals discount
Gadsden Arts Magazine (annual)
Family Membership
All of the above plus
Admission for four adults
Family Reciprocal Membership
All of the above plus
North American Reciprocal Museums membership
benefits at 1,442 member organizations!
Artists Guild Membership
All of the above plus
Invitation to exhibit in two exhibitions per year
Director’s Circle Membership
Family Reciprocal Membership benefits plus
Director’s Circle Previews
First option to make Art Trip reservations
First option to make Week with the Arts reservation
NARM Membership
The North American Reciprocal Museum (NARM) Association® network is a mosaic of 1,470 art museums and galleries, historical museums and societies, botanical gardens, children’s museums, zoos and more. When you sign up with your favorite participating NARM institution you can receive reciprocal membership benefits across the United States, Canada, Bermuda, El Salvador and Mexico.

Events
Opening Event
The American South Opening Reception
September 26, 2025, from 5PM – 7:30PM
Join us for the opening reception of
The American South: photographs by Jimmy Nicholson, Gordon Parks,
and Guggenheim Fellow
, exploring Southern history, culture, and identity.  Photographs will be on loan from the collection of the Do Good Fund (Columbus, Georgia).
Admission
:
Free for all members and children 17 and under
$5 for non-member adults | $3 for students
Dine & Discover
The American South
October 23, 2025, from 12:30PM – 1PM
Luncheon program: The American South through the Lens of Documentary Photography
(More information to be announced September 23rd).
Image: Jimmy Nicholson, 15 Vera’s Oyster Bar, Eastpoint, FL 1982, first printed 2020, gelatin silver print, 12 x 9 inches, in the exhibition The American South: Photographs by Jimmy Nicholson, Gordon Parks, and Guggenheim Fellows
Register Here
Youth and Family
Festive Family Day
December 6, 2025, from 10AM – 4PM
Celebrate the season with Gadsden Arts at Festive Family Day on December 7, a fun-filled event for the whole family! Enjoy holiday-themed crafts led by our Creative Futures Council.
(More information to be announced November 11th).
Gadsden Arts is a 2025 Blue Star Museum
May 17, 2025 — September 1, 2025
The Gadsden Arts Center & Museum announced it will join museums nationwide in the Blue Star Museums initiative, a program that provides free admission to currently-serving U.S. military personnel and their families this summer. The 2025 program will begin on Armed Forces Day, Saturday, May 17, 2025, and end on Labor Day, Monday, September 1, 2025.
To find participating museums in your community and/or to find other museums during your summer travels visit,
arts.gov/bluestarmuseums
.
Create your own special event!
Contact Museum Educator, Kaiyla Thompson
Are you looking for a fun and fascinating outing to experience with your club or group? Look no further! We offer a special event package that includes a personalized tour from one of our expert tour guides, a fun art activity that everyone will love, and free use of our meeting space so that you can order in lunch. Best of all, it’s included with the price of admission. Come to Gadsden Arts to create lasting memories with your team.
Book your event with us today!
FAQs

Creative Futures Council
CFC Overview
Applications open August 1, 2025
Our Creative Futures Council program, formerly called the Teen Art Council, hires teens and young adults to learn about art, museums, and arts careers through classes, projects, and field trips.
If accepted into the program, you will learn through zoom meetings, in-museum workshops, and regional field trips, and assist with planning and implementing events and programs at the Gadsden Arts Center & Museum. Students will also have the opportunity to participate in Field Trips and workshops with professional artists. The program culminates in an exhibition of students’ artwork at Gadsden Arts, during which each student presents their work through a class zoom event that is also recorded and presented online. If you would like additional information contact
Kaiyla Thompson
at (850) 627-5023.
The Creative Futures Council
is made possible by our
Art for Children & Youth Donors
,
Art Bridges
,
sponsors
Bell & Bates Home Center
and
Sunnyside Farm Management
, and a grant awarded by the
Community Foundation of North Florida.
